==Events==
*[[49 BC]] &ndash; [[Julius Caesar]] crosses the [[Rubicon]], signaling the start of [[Caesar's Civil War|civil war]].
*[[9]] &ndash; The Western [[Han Dynasty]] ends when [[Wang Mang]] claims that the divine [[Mandate of Heaven]] called for the end of the dynasty and the beginning of his own, the [[Xin Dynasty]].
*  [[69]] &ndash; [[Lucius Calpurnius Piso Licinianus]] is appointed by [[Galba]] as [[Caesar (title)|deputy Roman Emperor]].
* [[236]] &ndash; [[Pope Fabian]] succeeds [[Pope Anterus|Anterus]] to become the twentieth [[pope]] of [[Ancient Rome|Rome]].
*[[1072]] &ndash; [[Robert Guiscard]] conquers [[Palermo]].
*[[1475]] &ndash; [[Stephen III of Moldavia]] defeats the [[Ottoman Empire]] at the [[Battle of Vaslui]].
*[[1645]] &ndash; Archbishop [[William Laud]] is beheaded at the [[Tower of London]].
*[[1776]] &ndash; [[Thomas Paine]] publishes his pamphlet ''[[Common Sense (pamphlet)|Common Sense]]''.
*[[1791]] &ndash; The [[Siege of Dunlap's Station]] begins near [[Cincinnati]] during the [[Northwest Indian War]].
*[[1806]] &ndash; Dutch settlers in [[Cape Town]] surrender to the [[United Kingdom|British]].
*[[1810]] &ndash; [[Napoleon]] Bonaparte divorces his first wife [[Joséphine de Beauharnais|Joséphine]].
*[[1861]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: [[Florida]] secedes from the [[Union (American Civil War)|Union]].
*[[1863]] &ndash; The [[London Underground]], the world's oldest underground railway, opens between [[London Paddington station]] and [[Farringdon station]].
*[[1870]] &ndash; [[John D. Rockefeller]] incorporates [[Standard Oil]].
*[[1901]] &ndash; The first great [[Texas]] [[petroleum|oil]] gusher is discovered at [[Spindletop]] in [[Beaumont, Texas]].
*[[1916]] &ndash; [[World War I]]: In the [[Erzurum Offensive]], [[Russian Empire|Russia]] defeats the Ottoman Empire.
*[[1920]] &ndash; The [[Treaty of Versailles]] takes effect, officially ending World War I.
*[[1922]] &ndash; [[Arthur Griffith]] is elected President of the [[Dáil Éireann]].
*[[1923]] &ndash; [[Lithuania]] seizes and annexes [[Klaipėda|Memel]].
*[[1927]] &ndash; [[Fritz Lang]]'s futuristic film ''[[Metropolis (1927 film)|Metropolis]]'' is released in Germany.
*[[1929]] &ndash; ''[[The Adventures of Tintin]]'', one of the most popular European [[comic book]]s, is first published in Belgium.
*[[1941]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: The [[Greece|Greek]] army [[Capture of Klisura Pass|captures]] [[Këlcyrë|Kleisoura]].
*[[1946]] &ndash; The first [[United Nations General Assembly|General Assembly]] of the [[United Nations]] opens in London. Fifty-one nations are represented.
*  1946   &ndash; The [[United States Army]] [[Signal Corps (United States Army)|Signal Corps]] successfully conducts [[Project Diana]], bouncing [[radio waves]] off the [[moon]] and receiving the reflected signals.
*[[1954]] &ndash; [[BOAC Flight 781]], a de Havilland DH.106 Comet 1, explodes and falls into the [[Tyrrhenian Sea]] killing 35 people.
*[[1962]] &ndash; [[Apollo program]]: [[NASA]] announces plans to build the C-5 rocket [[launch vehicle]]. It became better known as the [[Saturn V]] Moon rocket, which launched every Apollo Moon mission.
*[[1972]] &ndash; [[Sheikh Mujibur Rahman]] returns to the newly independent [[Bangladesh]] as president after spending over nine months in prison in [[Pakistan]].
*[[1981]] &ndash; [[Salvadoran Civil War]]: The [[Farabundo Martí National Liberation Front|FMLN]] launches its first major offensive, gaining control of most of [[Morazán Department|Morazán]] and [[Chalatenango Department|Chalatenango]] departments
*[[1984]] &ndash; [[Holy See–United States relations]]: The [[United States]] and [[Holy See]] ([[Vatican City]]) re-establish full diplomatic relations after almost 117 years, overturning the [[United States Congress]]'s [[1867]] ban on public funding for such a diplomatic envoy.
*[[1985]] &ndash; [[Sandinista National Liberation Front|Sandinista]] [[Daniel Ortega]] becomes president of [[Nicaragua]] and vows to continue the transformation to socialism and alliance with the Soviet Union and Cuba; American policy continues to support the [[Contras]] in their revolt against the Nicaraguan government.
*[[1990]] &ndash; [[Time Warner]] is formed by the merger of [[Time Inc.]] and [[Warner Communications]].
*[[1999]] &ndash; [[Sanjeev Nanda]] kills three policemen in [[New Delhi|New Delhi, India]] with his car, an act for which he was later acquitted, resulting in a sharp drop in public confidence in the [[Judiciary of India|Indian legal system]].
*[[2005]] &ndash; A mudslide occurs in [[La Conchita, California]], killing 10 people, injuring many more and closing [[U.S. Route 101 in California|U.S. Route 101]], the main coastal corridor between [[Los Angeles]] and [[San Francisco]] for 10 days.
*[[2007]] &ndash; A [[2007 Guinean general strike|general strike]] begins in [[Guinea]] in an eventually successful attempt to get President [[Lansana Conté]] to resign.
*[[2011]] &ndash; [[2010–2011 Queensland floods]]: Torrential rain in the [[Lockyer Valley]] region of [[South East Queensland|South East Queensland, Australia]] causes severe flash flooding, killing 9 people.
*[[2012]] &ndash; A [[2012 Khyber Agency bombing|bombing]] in [[Khyber Agency]], [[Pakistan]], kills at least 30 people and 78 others injured.
*[[2013]] &ndash; More than 100 people are killed and 270 injured in several [[January 2013 Pakistan bombings|bomb blasts]] in [[Pakistan]].
